Session resource api This provides api for all things in session.

getMessage

@GET
@Produces(value="text/plain")
public String getMessage()
API to know if session service is up and running

Returns:
Simple text saying it up

openSession

@POST
@Consumes(value="multipart/form-data")
@Produces(value={"application/json","application/xml","text/plain"})
public GrillSessionHandle openSession(String username,
                                                             String password,
                                                             GrillConf sessionconf)
Create a new session with Grill server

Parameters:
username - User name of the Grill server user
password - Password of the Grill server user
sessionconf - Key-value properties which will be used to configure this session
Returns:
A Session handle unique to this session
Throws:
javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException - if there was an exception thrown while creating the session

closeSession

@DELETE
@Produces(value={"application/json","application/xml","text/plain"})
public APIResult closeSession(@QueryParam(value="sessionid")
                                              GrillSessionHandle sessionid)
Close a Grill server session

Parameters:
sessionid - Session handle object of the session to be closed
Returns:
APIResult object indicating if the operation was successful (check result.getStatus())
Throws:
javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException - if the underlying CLIService threw an exception while closing the session

addResource

@PUT
@Path(value="resources/add")
@Consumes(value="multipart/form-data")
@Produces(value={"application/json","application/xml","text/plain"})
public APIResult addResource(GrillSessionHandle sessionid,
                                                        String type,
                                                        String path)
Add a resource to the session to all GrillServices running in this Grill server

The returned @{link APIResult} will have status SUCCEEDED only if the add operation was successful for all services running in this Grill server.

Parameters:
sessionid - session handle object
type - The type of resource. Valid types are 'jar', 'file' and 'archive'
path - path of the resource
Returns:
APIResult with state APIResult.Status.SUCCEEDED, if add was successful. APIResult with state APIResult.Status.PARTIAL, if add succeeded only for some services. APIResult with state APIResult.Status.FAILED, if add has failed

deleteResource

@PUT
@Path(value="resources/delete")
@Consumes(value="multipart/form-data")
@Produces(value={"application/json","application/xml","text/plain"})
public APIResult deleteResource(GrillSessionHandle sessionid,
                                                           String type,
                                                           String path)
Delete a resource from sesssion from all the @{link GrillService}s running in this Grill server

Similar to addResource, this call is successful only if resource was deleted from all services.

Parameters:
sessionid - session handle object
type - The type of resource. Valid types are 'jar', 'file' and 'archive'
path - path of the resource to be deleted
Returns:
APIResult with state APIResult.Status.SUCCEEDED, if delete was successful. APIResult with state APIResult.Status.PARTIAL, if delete succeeded only for some services. APIResult with state APIResult.Status.FAILED, if delete has failed

getParams

@GET
@Path(value="params")
@Produces(value={"application/json","application/xml","text/plain"})
public StringList getParams(@QueryParam(value="sessionid")
                                              GrillSessionHandle sessionid,
                                              @DefaultValue(value="false")@QueryParam(value="verbose")
                                              boolean verbose,
                                              @DefaultValue(value="")@QueryParam(value="key")
                                              String key)
Get a list of key=value parameters set for this session

Parameters:
sessionid - session handle object
verbose - If true, all the parameters will be returned. If false, configuration parameters will be returned
key - if this is empty, output will contain all parameters and their values, if it is non empty parameters will be filtered by key
Returns:
List of Strings, one entry per key-value pair

setParam

@PUT
@Path(value="params")
@Produces(value={"application/json","application/xml","text/plain"})
public APIResult setParam(GrillSessionHandle sessionid,
                                            String key,
                                            String value)
Set value for a parameter specified by key The parameters can be a system property or a hive variable or a configuration. To set key as system property, the key should be prefixed with 'system:'. To set key as a hive variable, the key should be prefixed with 'hivevar:'. To set key as configuration parameter, the key should be prefixed with 'hiveconf:'. If no prefix is attached, the parameter is set as configuration. System properties are not restricted to the session, they would be set globally

Parameters:
sessionid - session handle object
key - parameter key
value - parameter value
Returns:
APIResult object indicating if set operation was successful
